item.content:encoded:
When it comes to the bright and bouncing-back world of the coworking industry, making high profits is not limited to the desks and Wi-Fi setup alone. It all comes down to thinking outside the box and coming up with pretty intelligent ways for making that extra moolah. Here are five simple ways through which you can explain to your coworking space on how best it can derive revenue and stay ahead.

1. Host Fun Events: Make Your Space the Place to Be Turn your coworking space into a cool events spot that people love to visit. From workshops to parties, several other things might be happening in the space, including giving birth to some of the trends.

By hosting events at the center, they reveal the space not only by renting it but also renting drinks and snacks sold at the occasion and helping in organizing the event. With some clever marketing, your space could become the go-to spot for all kinds of gatherings.

2. Special Membership Offer: Treat Your best customers like vIPs

Offer a special membership package to your most valued customers in such a way that makes them feel really special, exceeding the levels of a typical customer. Private desks, inviting space to exclusive events, or personal help when they need it. If people are ready to pay more for privileged treatment, such types of memberships also raise your space’s revenue.

 3.Froster connections and a collaborative environment: Build connections and boost your earnings by collaborating with other businesses. Create exclusive offers for your members, such as discounted gym memberships conveniently located just across the street. Forge partnerships with nearby cafes to ensure that your members always enjoy affordable coffee options. Let’s foster a community where networking not only leads to friendships but also to financial benefits.

To sum up, by helping you work with others, this section will help you give extra value to your members, and hopefully, earn yourself some extra cash along the way through referral fees and other agreements.

4. Be Flexible: Change with the Times

The way people work is always changing, so it’s important to be flexible.Offer different kinds of workspaces, like virtual offices or short-term rentals, which would meet different people’s needs. Being versatile guarantees that you are occupying 100 percent space, hence an assured opportunity to make that extra dollar around the clock all year.

5. Offer Extra Services: Give People What They Want

Think of what else your members may need and offer it. They most likely need computer help or would like to learn some new skills. You will also have a chance at earning an extra profit and, in the process, create satisfaction among them through additional services like IT support or workshops.

In summary, therefore, the quest to make more in this business leaves one to have to be creative, work with others, and give people what they want. There are easy approaches for the host of events, special memberships, partnering with others, being flexible, and offering extra services that could help increase revenues and make the coworking space successful.

item.content:encoded:
The concept of working from virtual offices has become the new normal. The setup is digitized so that one can work from absolutely anywhere while projecting a professional view. This trend challenges the coworking industry in spaces known as “the communal work hubs where people and small businesses come together,” as the dictionary defines them. Look at how virtual offices are damaging coworking spaces and how they can be mitigated.

The Decline in Membership: Empty Desks and Diminishing Foot Traffic

Many coworking spaces are losing memberships as the pool of virtual offices grows and becomes a rising trend.

People are going contemporary, finding it more comfortable to work from wherever they are and prefer to avoid signing up for a physical office. This leaves many coworking spaces with empty desks, low foot traffic, and non-vibrancy.

Disruption in the Coworking Landscape: Shifting Demands and Expectations

With its members’ changing needs and expectations, coworking spaces still have to align themselves with the new norm of a virtual office. This attractiveness of remote work is forcing rethinking among most people and companies about the need for physical office spaces, and the trend has resulted in falling numbers of members at traditional coworking spaces.

That will make hybrid work models, which meld full-time and part-time remote and in-person collaboration for coworking spaces, all the more confusing.

Competition for Clients: Losing the Battle for Business

Virtual offices have made the competition tough for coworking spaces to attract customers. This has now become a phenomenon that benefits businesses and freelancers not attached to a location. It has increased the scramble of the coworking spaces to keep their existing clientele and draw new faces—a hard business landscape for them.

The strain on Community Dynamics: Fracturing the Sense of Community

The latter form of coworking spaces is driven by community interaction and collaboration in a way that, at times, unfails the virtual offices in their wake. This is so because, with less physical human presence, there is reduced camaraderie and a general sense of purpose, often leaving a gap among the members and diluting the vibrant atmosphere of coworking spaces.

Financial Pressures: Tightening Budgets and Tough Decisions

The virtual office has quite an economic effect on coworking. This must modulate with a dwindling membership at the coworking space and increasing competition, which now leads to an increasing financial heat. This leaves them making hard decisions on strict mechanisms that cut costs and pricing strategies to survive in a hostile market.

Navigating the Virtual Office Storm

It could also test for the opportunity to think innovatively and adaptively in the face of several challenges, such as plummeting membership, financial strains, and community dynamics.

This leaves plenty of room to define the value proposition further, strengthen community relationships, and find new revenue potentials so that coworking spaces can compete with virtual offices head-on and emerge all the better and more durable for it in this ever-evolving modern work environment.

However, virtual offices provide firm challenges, but they also offer opportunities for innovation and adaptation to coworking spaces. This is done through understanding how the dynamic needs of the members can satisfy the improvement of the level of community participation and using technology to improve the service of the workplace.

Ultimately, therefore, coworking spaces can continue to flourish amidst the current thrust in the landscape of modern work by accepting this change while at the same time remaining true to their central values of collaboration and community.

Coworking spaces have become increasingly popular in recent years, as more and more people move away from traditional office settings. Coworking spaces offer a number of advantages for businesses of all sizes, including flexibility, affordability, and a sense of community.

If you’re considering investing in a coworking space, there are a few things you need to know. In this blog post, we’ll discuss the top five reasons why investing in a coworking space in 2023 is a smart move.

1. Coworking spaces are a growing trend

The coworking industry is growing rapidly and is expected to continue to grow in the coming years. This is due to a number of factors, including the rise of remote work, the increasing number of freelancers and entrepreneurs, and the need for more flexible workspaces.

As the coworking industry continues to grow, so too will the demand for coworking spaces. This means that investors in coworking spaces can expect to see good returns on their investment.

2. Coworking spaces are affordable

Coworking spaces are a more affordable option than traditional office space. This is because coworking spaces typically offer a variety of membership options, so businesses can choose the option that best fits their needs and budget.

In addition, coworking spaces typically include all of the amenities that businesses need, such as high-speed internet, conference rooms, and printing services. This means that businesses don’t have to worry about incurring additional costs for these amenities.

3. Coworking spaces offer flexibility

Coworking spaces offer businesses a great deal of flexibility. Businesses can rent a desk, a private office, or a team space for as long or as short as they need. This flexibility is especially appealing to businesses that are growing or downsizing, or that need to move frequently.

In addition, coworking spaces typically offer flexible hours, so businesses can come and go as they need. This is ideal for businesses with employees who work different hours or need to meet with clients outside of traditional business hours.

4. Coworking spaces provide a sense of community

Coworking spaces provide businesses with a sense of community. Coworkers come from a variety of industries and backgrounds, which can lead to new ideas, partnerships, and collaborations.

Coworking spaces also typically host events and workshops, which can help businesses learn new skills and network with other professionals.

5. Coworking spaces are environmentally friendly

Coworking spaces are typically more environmentally friendly than traditional office spaces. This is because coworking spaces are typically shared by multiple businesses, which reduces the amount of energy and resources that are consumed.

In addition, coworking spaces often have sustainable features, such as recycled materials, energy-efficient appliances, and natural light.

Once you have found a location, you need to build out your coworking space. This will involve furnishing the space and providing the necessary amenities, such as high-speed internet, conference rooms, and printing services.

Finally, you need to market your coworking space to potential members. You can do this through online and offline marketing channels.

How to Invest in Coworking Spaces in India

Table of Contents

The coworking space industry is growing rapidly in India, with new spaces opening up every day. This is due to a number of factors, including the increasing number of startups and freelancers, the rising cost of office space, and the growing demand for flexible workspaces.

If you are interested in investing in coworking spaces in India, there are a few things you need to know.

Coworking Investment Ideas & Advantages

There are a few different ways to invest in coworking spaces. You can:

  • Open your own Coworking Space.

     This is the most involved option, but it also gives you the most control over the business. You will need to find a suitable location, lease the space, furnish it, and market it to tenants.

  • Invest in a Coworking Space Franchise.

     This is a less risky option, as you will be partnering with a proven brand. There are a number of coworking space franchises available in India, such as WeWork, Regus, and CoWrkz.

  • Invest in a Coworking Space Real Estate Fund.

     This is a way to invest in the coworking space industry without having to manage your own space. There are a number of coworking space real estate funds available in India, such as InnoVen Capital and CoHo Living.

No matter which option you choose, there are a number of advantages to investing in coworking spaces. These include:

  • High demand. The demand for coworking spaces is growing rapidly, so there is a good chance of your investment being successful. According to a report by JLL, the coworking space market in India is expected to grow at a CAGR of 25% from 2022 to 2027.
  • High returns. The returns on investment in coworking spaces can be very high, especially in the early stages of the industry. A report by Knight Frank India found that the average return on investment for coworking space investors was 25% in 2021.
  • Low risk. The risk of investing in coworking spaces is relatively low, as the industry is still in its early stages of growth. The coworking space industry is still relatively new in India, so there is less competition than in other countries.

Future of Coworking Investment In India

The future of coworking investment in India looks bright. The industry is expected to continue to grow rapidly in the coming years, driven by the factors mentioned above. The increasing number of startups and freelancers, the rising cost of office space, and the growing demand for flexible workspaces are all factors that will contribute to the growth of the coworking space industry in India.

If you are looking for a profitable investment opportunity, coworking spaces should be on your radar.

Factors to Consider When Investing in Coworking Spaces in India:

  • Location: The location of the coworking space is critical to its success. It should be in a central location that is easily accessible to tenants.
  • Amenities: The coworking space should offer a variety of amenities to attract tenants, such as high-speed internet, conference rooms, and coffee stations.
  • Management: The coworking space should be well-managed and provide excellent customer service.
  • Brand: If you are investing in a coworking space franchise, it is important to choose a brand that is well-known and has a good reputation.
  • Market: It is important to research the coworking space market in the city or region where you plan to invest. This will help you to identify the demand for coworking spaces and the competition.

Risks Associated with Investing in Coworking Spaces:

  • High competition: The coworking space industry is becoming increasingly competitive. This means that it is important to choose a good location and offer competitive amenities in order to attract tenants.
  • Fluctuating demand: The demand for coworking spaces can fluctuate depending on the economic climate. This means that it is important to do your research and choose a location that is likely to be in demand even during economic downturns.
  • Operational costs: The operational costs of running a coworking space can be high. This includes the cost of rent, utilities, and staff. It is important to factor these costs into your investment analysis.

Conclusion

If you are considering investing in coworking spaces in India, there are a few things you need to keep in mind. Do your research, choose the right location, and manage the space well. With careful planning, you can make a profitable investment in the coworking space industry.

    There are a few different ways to invest in coworking space. You can:

    • Open your own coworking space.
    • Invest in a coworking space franchise.
    • Invest in a coworking space real estate fund.

  • Is coworking really the future?

    Yes, coworking is really the future of work. The traditional office model is becoming increasingly outdated, as more and more people are looking for flexible and collaborative workspaces.

    There are a few reasons why coworking spaces fail. These include:

The Rise of Coworking Spaces and the Potential of a Coworking Franchise

Coworking spaces have seen a tremendous rise in popularity in recent years and with good reason. Coworking spaces offer a flexible, affordable and collaborative alternative as the traditional office model becomes less appealing to entrepreneurs, freelancers, and small businesses.

The potential of a coworking franchise is undeniable. By tapping into the growing demand for shared workspaces, entrepreneurs can capitalize on this booming industry while benefiting from an established brand and support system.

A coworking franchise provides a turnkey solution for individuals looking to enter the market. With a proven business model and ongoing support from the franchisor, entrepreneurs can focus on building relationships with their members and creating a thriving community within their space.

The benefits of joining a coworking franchise are numerous. Franchisees gain access to comprehensive training programs, marketing support, and operational guidance. This allows them to hit the ground running and quickly establish themselves as leaders in their local market.

Furthermore, being part of a larger network of coworking spaces opens up opportunities for collaboration and cross-promotion. Members can enjoy the flexibility of working from any location within the franchise network, creating a sense of community that extends beyond individual spaces.

In conclusion, as the demand for flexible workspaces continues to grow, investing in a coworking franchise presents an exciting opportunity for entrepreneurs. With its proven success and ongoing support system, this business model allows individuals to tap into the potential of this thriving industry while making a positive impact on their local entrepreneurial ecosystem.

The Benefits of Owning a Coworking Franchise

    • Lucrative Market: Exploring the booming demand for flexible workspaces and how it translates into profitability.

    • Proven Business Model: Highlighting the advantages of investing in an established franchise system with a track record of success.

    • Simplified Operations: Showcasing how franchisors provide support systems, technology platforms, and operational guidelines to streamline business management.

India’s coworking sector has experienced tremendous growth in recent years, presenting lucrative franchise opportunities for aspiring entrepreneurs. With the rise of remote work and the increasing demand for flexible office spaces, coworking has become a thriving industry in India.

For those looking to enter the franchise business in India, investing in a coworking franchise can be a smart move. The latest franchise opportunities in India’s booming coworking sector offer a chance to tap into this rapidly expanding market and capitalize on its potential.

By becoming a franchisee, you can leverage an established brand, proven business model, and ongoing support from the franchisor. This significantly reduces the risks associated with starting a new venture from scratch.

The beauty of coworking franchises lies in their ability to provide turnkey solutions for entrepreneurs and professionals seeking flexible workspace solutions. These franchises typically offer fully furnished offices, shared amenities, networking opportunities, and additional services such as meeting rooms and virtual office facilities.

Moreover, as more companies embrace remote work policies and seek cost-effective alternatives to traditional office spaces, the demand for coworking spaces is only expected to grow further. This presents an excellent opportunity for franchisees to capitalize on this trend and establish themselves as key players in the Indian coworking landscape.

Whether you are an experienced entrepreneur or someone looking to venture into business ownership for the first time, exploring the latest franchise opportunities in India’s booming coworking sector can be a game-changer. With proper due diligence and strategic planning, you can position yourself at the forefront of this thriving industry while reaping substantial financial rewards.

Don’t miss out on this exciting chance to be part of India’s flourishing coworking ecosystem. Invest in a well-established coworking franchise today and embark on your journey toward entrepreneurial success!

Requirements To Open Coworking Franchise

If you’re an aspiring entrepreneur looking to dive into the world of coworking spaces, opening a coworking franchise can be an exciting and lucrative opportunity.

However, before you embark on this venture, it’s crucial to understand the essential requirements that come with it. First and foremost, you must have a deep passion for fostering a collaborative and innovative community, as coworking spaces thrive on fostering connections among diverse professionals.

Understanding the local market demand and selecting the right location is equally vital – a bustling urban area or a burgeoning business district can significantly impact the success of your franchise.

Additionally, ensure you have a well-defined business plan, covering financial projections, marketing strategies, and operational procedures.

Of course, securing sufficient capital is crucial to kickstart your franchise, so having a solid financial plan and access to funding sources is essential.

Lastly, choosing the right coworking brand with a proven track record and strong support system can provide a solid foundation for your franchise’s growth and success. By fulfilling these requirements, you’ll be better prepared to make your mark in the coworking industry and create a thriving and welcoming space for professionals in your community.

In conclusion, investing in a coworking franchise presents a unique and lucrative opportunity for entrepreneurs and business-minded individuals. The rise of remote work and the increasing demand for flexible office spaces have created a thriving market for coworking spaces.

By investing in a coworking franchise, you can tap into this growing trend and capitalize on the changing landscape of work. With a proven business model, established brand recognition, and ongoing support from the franchisor, you can mitigate many of the risks associated with starting a new venture.

Moreover, coworking spaces offer numerous benefits to both freelancers and small businesses. They provide a professional environment, access to amenities, networking opportunities, and a sense of community that traditional offices may lack. As more professionals seek flexible work arrangements, the demand for coworking spaces is expected to continue rising.

By investing in a coworking franchise today, you position yourself at the forefront of this industry’s growth. You have the chance to create an innovative workspace that meets the evolving needs of modern professionals while generating substantial returns on your investment.

Don’t miss out on this opportunity. Take the leap into entrepreneurship by investing in a coworking franchise today and reap the rewards of being part of this dynamic industry. Seize this chance to build your own successful business while providing valuable services to professionals needing flexible workspace solutions.

 

FAQ’s

  • 1. Is coworking business profitable?

    Yes, a coworking business can be profitable if it is well-planned and executed effectively. The profitability of a coworking business depends on several factors, such as location, pricing strategy, target market, operating costs, and the overall demand for flexible workspace solutions in the area.

  • 2. How do i start coworking office?

    Starting a coworking office requires careful planning and execution. Here are the essential steps to guide you through the process:

    1. Market Research: Begin by conducting thorough market research to identify the demand for coworking spaces in your chosen location. Analyze the target audience, competition, and potential growth opportunities.

    2. Business Plan: Develop a comprehensive business plan that outlines your objectives, target market, pricing strategy, marketing approach, financial projections, and operational details. A well-structured business plan will help you stay focused and attract potential investors or lenders.

    3. Location: Choose a strategic and accessible location that aligns with your target market. Opt for areas with a high concentration of professionals, startups, and businesses, or close to transportation hubs for convenience.

    4. Space Design: Design a functional and aesthetically appealing workspace that fosters creativity, productivity, and collaboration. Consider flexible layouts, comfortable furniture, meeting rooms, and essential amenities like high-speed internet and refreshment areas.

    5. Legal and Regulatory Compliance: Register your business and ensure you comply with all local laws, regulations, and licensing requirements for running a coworking space.

    6. Financing: Determine the initial investment required to start the coworking office. Secure financing through personal savings, bank loans, or investors.

  • 3. How does coworking make money?

    Coworking spaces employ several revenue streams to generate income and sustain their operations. Here are some ways in which coworking spaces make money:

    1. Membership Fees: The primary source of revenue for coworking spaces is membership fees. They offer various membership plans, such as daily passes, part-time memberships, hot desks, dedicated desks, and private offices, each with different pricing tiers based on usage and amenities.

    2. Private Office Rentals: Coworking spaces often provide private office spaces with additional services and amenities. These private offices are offered at premium rates and cater to businesses or individuals seeking a more exclusive and enclosed workspace.

    3. Meeting Room Rentals: Coworking spaces typically have well-equipped meeting rooms that members can rent for client meetings, workshops, seminars, or other events. These rentals contribute to additional revenue.

    4. Virtual Office Services: Some coworking spaces offer virtual office services, which include a business address, mail handling, and call forwarding. These services attract remote businesses or entrepreneurs seeking a professional address without the need for physical office space.

    5. Event Space Rentals: Coworking spaces often have event spaces that can be rented out for networking events, product launches, or corporate gatherings. These events generate revenue and increase the visibility of the coworking space.

    6. Additional Services: Coworking spaces may offer extra services like printing and scanning facilities, high-speed internet access, storage lockers, and catering services. These add-ons provide convenience to members and create additional revenue streams.

    7. Partnerships and Sponsorships: Coworking spaces can partner with local businesses or service providers to offer exclusive deals to their members. In return, these partnerships may lead to commissions or sponsorships, benefiting both parties.

    8. Corporate Memberships: Some coworking spaces offer corporate membership packages tailored to businesses with multiple employees. Corporate memberships often come with additional benefits and discounts, making them an attractive option for companies.

    9. Affiliate Programs: Coworking spaces can join affiliate programs with various service providers, such as software companies or office supply vendors. When their members purchase products or services through these partnerships, the coworking space earns a commission.

    10. Workshops and Events: Coworking spaces may organize workshops, training sessions, or educational events. These events not only add value to the community but also generate revenue through ticket sales or additional fees.

    By combining these revenue streams and maintaining a vibrant and supportive community, coworking spaces can achieve financial sustainability and continue to provide valuable services to their members.

  • 4. How do i start a coworking office?

    Starting a coworking office can be a rewarding venture if done right. Follow these steps to kickstart your coworking journey:

    1. Market Research: Research the demand for coworking spaces in your area, understand your target audience, and identify your competition.

    2. Business Plan: Create a detailed business plan outlining your goals, target market, pricing strategy, financial projections, and operational framework.

    3. Location: Choose a strategic location near business hubs or transportation centers to attract potential members.

    4. Space Design: Design a flexible and inviting workspace that fosters collaboration and productivity.

    5. Legal Compliance: Ensure you comply with all legal and regulatory requirements for running a coworking office.

    6. Financing: Secure funding through personal savings, loans, or investors.

    7. Membership Plans: Offer diverse membership options to cater to various needs and budgets.

    8. Marketing: Develop a strong brand identity and use effective marketing strategies to promote your coworking office.

    9. Community Building: Foster a supportive community by organizing networking events and workshops.

    10. Operations: Implement efficient management systems to handle memberships and facility maintenance.

item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

Infosys recently announced permanent Work From Home for 33% to 55% of its employees. On similar lines, TCS too claimed that by 2025, only 25% of its workforce will be coming its offices. As traditional workplaces decentralise, and WFH fatigue kicks in, coworking spaces will be in their best position to showcase themselves as ad-hoc solutions.

Aren’t we convinced already that work from home cannot be a permanent set-up for India? Coworking units will now act as ad-hoc spaces while enterprises try to figure out the new normal.

What will businesses look out for in a coworking space post COVID-19?

    • The Need for an Office

Take the example of Chennai-based Karya Spaces for example. Karya Spaces opened a new centre in Nungambakkam in January. Instead of making the most of the booming commercial real estate industry, witnessed a massive downfall as client base dropped by 30% in March.

However, since the lockdown restrictions have been eased in May, nearly 100 enquiries to rent desks are flooding in. For any company to develop and thrive, real-life interaction of the workforce is essential. And that’s where the importance of offices, or rather coworking spaces kicks in.

    • The Need for a Community

We did some research and most employees when given a choice between an office and a coworking space, would choose the latter. Unlike traditional offices, a coworking space encourages people to interact with those from similar and different businesses.

It’s like an informal collaboration of sorts because you can exchange fresh ideas, perspectives, and contacts.

    • The Need for Safe Spaces

Before the pandemic, coworking spaces that offered 450 seats are cutting it down to say 240 seats to maintain social distancing. They are also providing safety equipments, setting new hygiene protocols, handsfree entries, etc.

To attract businesses and ensure the safety of the workforce, coworking spaces are moving from a rental model to a hospitality set-up. In addition to infrastructure and safety measures, they are also providing new services, software, etc.

Landlords and property owners that meet and exceed these new expectations can greatly benefit from the coworking boom that’s already upon us. As JLL predicts, corporate demand will grow significantly after the pandemic, as many major companies like Starbucks, Microsoft, and Facebook are already on the lookout for coworking spaces.

item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

Coworking spaces are a boon for startups and small businesses. They are cost effective, flexible, and allow people from diverse backgrounds to congregate and collaborate with each other to resolve business and social challenges of the day. These benefits gave rise to a spike of coworking office leasing from 8 percent in 2018 to 14 percent in 2019.

In recent few years, larger companies too, especially in the tech industry, have started identifying the benefits of operating in a coworking space. In fact, a survey conducted by a real estate firm showcased that 40 to 45 percent of demand came from large firms. This demand for coworking office lease was followed by the SME sector at 35 to 40 percent, and interestingly the demand from start-ups came at just 15-25 percent.

Why?

Large corporations are able to network and tap into a rich talent pool to making collaborations and acquisitions, flexibility of operations, reduced overhead cost.

Let’s deep-dive into how large organizations are taking advantage of coworking for expansion:

  1. Talent and Innovation

Coworking spaces offer easy access to talent and innovation. So, it allows large companies to stay closer to the action and initiate strategic acquisitions with potential industry disruptors. Cowork spaces also help corporate zero down on possible acquisition targets in the future.

  1. The Coworking Trend Survives COVID-19 Better

With flexible workstation options and lower CAPEX investment requirements over traditional offices, coworking spaces have helped businesses save on cost.

  1. Flexibility Options

Work from a shared office space offers great flexibility when it comes to testing out a new location and operational hours. For instance, if a business needs to work on a special project that requires setting up a satellite or remote office, it is convenient to choose a coworking space than to lease for a fixed amount of time. Similarly, if a company finds the location of a particular coworking space suitable for their needs, it gives them an opportunity for expansion as well.

Even the company employees can now opt between working at a head office or operating from a convenient location.

  1. Low Rental Cost

Thanks to coworking spaces, large corporations can save on their operational costs, opportunity cost, and also rental cost. They also spend less on internet, furniture, reception, housekeeping, and other office facilities.

item.content:encoded:
As companies are looking for a more flexible office space format and remote workers requesting part-time offices away from home, the workspace sector seems to be on its path to reach normalcy. On that positive note, here are the emerging space utilization trends that our experts predict to be essential for a new normal world.

Declutter the Floor

We are breaking out divisions into separate offices because adjacent offices with glass in between provide the feeling of proximity. This redesigning idea helps retain the division of space while also enhancing the buzz of energy and exchanging ideas. We are also enabling coworking businesses design lounge spaces and break-out spaces to collaborate or work alongside each other. These areas eliminate the sense of silo created by the more conventional office and cubicle grid format. Of course, all floor plan design changes are undertaken with COVID-19 compliance safety in mind.

Our team is designing easy access zones for hand-sanitizers, gloves, and masks. We are informing our clients and their property managers on the importance of frequent disinfecting and social contracts like not using the middle seats of couches or following social distancing.

Activity-Based Working Spaces

Introduce activity-based working spaces designed for the type of work an employee needs to do on a given day.

For example:

  • Open and comfortable areas for group work sessions
  • Isolated quiet areas
  • Open lounge areas

These spaces boost efficiency and productivity as coworkers can choose the space they find the most comfort in depending on the task they need to complete. These features in a coworking space increase interaction and collaboration and foster creative thinking and innovation.

Fresh Air & Natural Sunlight

According to an HBR study in 2019, natural sunlight was the #1 factor for employee happiness. This holds particularly true for the current scenario as we have employees working from home for months together. So, the trend for natural sunlight and fresh air is here to stay and become essential.

We encourage the use of terraces and sunny offices with windows in your workspace.

Flexible Leases

The demand for flexible leases is accelerating steadily, with a steep trajectory from 5% to 30%. Not only startups and medium-sized companies, but also large enterprises are opting for coworking spaces over traditional office setups because the immediate return to normal requires teams to rotate days onsite. So, financially speaking, coworking spaces look like a smart idea due to the flexibility in leases offered by them.

We are helping coworking space owners to chalk out new lease agreements and membership plans to attract clients.

We expect this overview to inspire everyone to update the workstation environment by bringing the new standard. When done correctly, it will motivate coworkers to stay productive and efficient.

item.content:encoded:
Table of Contents

These are testing times for the coworking industry, and it is more important than ever to understand where the market is headed. Hence, we bring you the Global Coworking Study 2020 that explores the future of the coworking sector.

Overview

By 2024, the number of coworking spaces worldwide is estimated to cross 40,000. The commercial real estate industry will grow at a slower pace this year, but it’s going to rebound and develop even more rapidly post 2020 at a yearly growth rate of over 21%.

As per our field experts, approximately 5 million people will be working from coworking spaces by 2024.

Insights

Though the COVID-19 lockdown bought the growth of the coworking industry to a screeching halt, the overall outlook for 2021 seems extremely positive.

We even evaluated data from the 2019 Coworker Member’s Choice Awards. It showcases that before the coronavirus hit the world economy, 77% of the coworking operators planned to expand by opening new locations. Additionally, 32% of operators planned to open one new location by 2020, and 38% planned to open 2 to 3 new locations.

It seems that almost 9% of respondents said they plan to open 8+ new locations by the end of 2020. These projections show that many multi-location spaces are turning into small chains that serve entire regions.

Size & Capacity

The Coworker’s Coworking Size & Capacity Report, Asia is the continent with the highest average capacity of 114 people. Next in line is South America with the lowest average capacity of 54 people. China ranked as the country with the largest capacity, with 282 people on average per space (within Asia). In terms of space size though, the country with the largest spaces in the world is North America, with an average size of 9,799 sq.ft. per space. This number is followed by Asia at 8,101 sq. ft.

As more businesses implement flexible working practices, the capacity to continue to create extra time will become increasingly essential to space operators, as serviced offices and remote teams are being built.

Geography

With more than 3,700 workspaces across the world, America remains the biggest market. The second in position is India with 2,197 spaces, followed by United Kingdom with 1,044 spaces. When talking about annual growth in 2020, Germany and India are the two fastest-growing countries, followed by America and Canada.

Prices

The downward trend in prices is mirrored in various regions in the world as the coworking industry becomes mainstream. However, in Europe prices increased by almost 12% over the past 2 years.

When it comes to country rankings, Monaco stayed on the top spot in 2019- 2020 for most expensive monthly hot desk price at $397 per month. This was followed by Switzerland at $395 per month and Malta with $347 per month.

Post-COVID Predictions

We analyzed over 2,500 requests between February 2020 (pre-lockdowns) and May 2020 (post-lockdowns). It was observed that space utilization is beginning to recover and there’s a rising shift toward private offices, longer-term contract durations, and higher capacities of desks needed.

Preliminary data shows 76% higher share of requests for private offices compared to individual seats, 26% higher number of seats per request, and 96% higher contract terms.

In a post-COVID-19 world, demand is predicted to mainly come from larger organizations and enterprises that are looking to decentralize their workforces into smaller branch offices and private flex offices. That said, in the next couple of years, all offices will turn into flexible, on-demand spaces, which holds the potential for the coworking industry to grow and thrive.
